summary: out-of-home child care (CC) is a risk factor for viral acute respiratory infection (ARI) in young children. CC children 2 years had slightly lower odds of viral detection during illness (OR = 0.89, 95% CI [0.49, 1.61]); neither was statistically significant. CC attendees aged 0–6y experienced illness episodes earlier in life compared with homecare children. compared with children cared for at home, CC children were less at risk for rhinovirus infection when young.
